definition: national humiliation, refers to Japanese incursions into China in the 1930s and 40s, and more especially to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
Never forget national humiliation, refers to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria

sentences.english: After the unequal treaties made, all records of the Chinese national humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 不平等条约订立的经过，全为中国国耻的记录。

sentences.english: The seizure of American hostages in Iran sharpened the pain of national humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗扣押美国人质的行动加剧了国耻的痛苦。

sentences.english: Indelible history, can not forget national humiliation.
sentences.chinese: 历史不可磨灭，国耻不能忘却。

sentences.english: Mr Putin seems to regard foreign debt as a sort of national insult, and is paying most of it off.
sentences.chinese: 普京似乎将外债视为国耻，因此正在偿还其中的大半。

definition: Never forget national humiliation, refers to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
don't forget past events, they can guide you in future (idiom); benefit from past experience
pinyin: qian2 shi4 bu4 wang4 , hou4 shi4 zhi1 shi1

definition: to die in an accident/to die for a just cause
victim of an accident/casualty/martyr for one's country
much hardships may awaken a nation (idiom); calamity that prompts renewal
to invade China (referring to 19th century imperialist powers and Japan)
(literary) foreign aggression/external threat/humiliation inflicted by outsiders
